main event: An observer sighted a bright white light on the horizon to the southwest that was about as bright as the full moon.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 5 minutes., The observation type was ground-visual., The object was seen in a clear sky during the night., The observer noted that the object appeared to be solid., MARS was setting in the sky at the time of the sighting.
witness description: one observer with a clear view of the object
